website_summaries.verdict: The Amazon Kindle Voyage is one of the nicest best ebook readers available, though most people will still be served just fine by the Kindle Paperwhite.
cons: No memory card slot or ePub support

customer_reviews.title: I love my Kindle!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I used to have the old version then I bought this one and the improvements are amazing...it has a built in light with autocorrect level of brightness that makes it easy to read from it anywhere. I also love the size, u can hold it in one hand so easily . I'm addicted to reading from my kindle !
customer_reviews.author: Luma Dajani

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Kindle Keyboard for 6 years and needed to replace, so I decided to go for the Kindle Voyage. Loving it so far just finding the library a little more challenging to navigate...but that's because I have a lot of books to organize and sort into collections....battery life has been great...the backlight that is adjustable pure heaven... I needed to get a cover for the Voyage because it was so light, especially compared to the Kindle Keyboard, I forgot that I was holding on to it. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Milissa

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Voyage
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my Voyage. It's a little smaller than the Paperwhite, the screen is very good, the lighting also very good. I have only had it for a week, but I would say that the reading experience is as good on the Paperwhite. But I like the smaller size - the smaller the better in my opinion, as I carry it with me everywhere and it fits into even my smallest purse ☺
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: ... released but sold it soon since I was not happy with the way how the screen was illuminated
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first Paperwhite when it released but sold it soon since I was not happy with the way how the screen was illuminated. I thought that the 2nd or 3rd update will be much better - so I decided to wait. And when the Voyager came out I decided to give it a try instead of buying the "normal" new generation paperwhite. I am not disappointed, it really works as advertised. I think it was worth for waiting, thanks a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Attila

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of the voyage and the ease of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kindle and I purchased it because of smaller weight and size particularly for a travel packed handbag.I like the size of the voyage and the ease of removing the practical cover.The back lighting is comfortable after personal adjustment, unfortunely I find my hand is uncomfortable after reading and I may revert to using my previous four year old paperwhite because of this. The Oasis may have been the better choice but as I had no access to the physical Voyage or Oasis chose purely on size and weight. I will continue to use a Kindle device as my e reader.
customer_reviews.author: Mellis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light thin and great battery for us serious readers.
customer_reviews.text: This kindle is amazing!! I went from using a kindle fire for reading to this and I couldn't be happier. It's so light and thin. No more hand strain. The battery lasts ages. I often read several hours per day and this stays up in the high 80s after 6 hours of a marathon reading session. I freaking love it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Bell

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kindle, maybe need to work on my page turning skills..
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing my older kindle that I finally broke after 7 years by dropping it while reading in bed and falling asleep. I like that it remembers wifi passwords and stays connected without losing battery life rapidly. Touch screen works well. The only thing that may be a little off is the touch screen page turner. If I want to go back or forward several pages quickly, it seems to go forward when I wanted to go back, or vice versa. Maybe I am doing something wrong, but I miss the old school page turning buttons that were very straightforward and functioned perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: iLikeStuff

customer_reviews.title: The Kindle Voyage is a great, smooth and enjoyable reading experience
customer_reviews.text: Simply wonderful device to read on. I would recommend highly the voyage as your new e-reader. I have the Kindle touch and it has been excellent all these years and I have abused it terribly by leaving in the car during sub zero temp and extreme heat. It has always started up and worked effortlessly. It is starting to show it's age and now the voyage and taken it's place as a wonderful gift to me. I love reading on the voyage
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: At this point I can say it is a really good choice for those who love to read anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy two books for 45$ until I saw them available on the Kindle Unlimmited catalog. That encouraged to buy the kindle Voyage and get the 30 days "try" to read those books. At this point I can say it is a really good choice for those who love to read anywhere. Thanks to its light you do not need to be worried about the illumination anymore, and it is perfect to read at bed. Furthermore, it is really comfortable to navigate through the kindle store and get the books you want in seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this e readers so much as a person who ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this e readers so much as a person who reads 3 to 4 hours a day I really like it , the battery is great specially when I put it on airplane mode. The only problem is it's not waterproof and with some one who reads a lot accidents happen , also this is my second kindle I bought the first one on February and after 3 months it fell on the floor and the screen is not working anymore so it's like waste of money, I mean our iPhones falls a lot before something happens to the screen. So I had to buy another one after only 3 months of buying the first .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, thin last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Like - auto light adjustment - light, almost too light - thin, almost too thin - battery life Would Like - better one hand grip. It slips in MY hand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Good Reader, Good Functionality but Expensive
customer_reviews.text: Nice reader with good functionality. Easy to read, clear, easier to turn pages and much better to read in a dark room. All the functionality listed works well. The only negative is the value for money question. The additional $100+ for the additional functionality does not seem proportional.
customer_reviews.author: Ron McKerrow

customer_reviews.title: Very easy on the eyes
customer_reviews.text: Very easy on the eyes. Works well. I had a Kindle Fire previously where games could be downloaded and you could use the net etc. This device is perfect if you want to use it exclusively as a reader without any other bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Chong

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Very light and portable. The page-turning button is a bit hard to press. While it is still painful that it does not support epub and books purchased on different amazon websites (from different countries and languages) still do not co-exist. It serves a single purpose relatively satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: kid

customer_reviews.title: Not-so-sure
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure. Device turns and and off without me doing anything. The special cover that one must purchase seems to have something to do with the on/off issues. Also, I have found it very difficult to consult the first pages then return to the pages that I was reading....probably my fault, but have not been able to retrieve the manual again. Too much money for too many problems.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hearty

customer_reviews.title: The size and the lighting are nice, however I have been unable to figure out ...
customer_reviews.text: The size and the lighting are nice, however I have been unable to figure out how to sort my read books from the unread books so they don't all show up all the time. It is a real pain to sort through hundreds of books all the time to find one you have not read.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great update to my old e-reader, but not without some quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Generally a great experience. The new adaptive lighting is fantastic. The only issue I've experienced is that sometimes it is not very good about resuming from sleep and requires a reboot, but this is rare. Have already read through 5 books in 3 days on this and its going strong. Great upgrade from my old e reader.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Duzan

customer_reviews.title: Superb reading device.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reading device. Crisp fonds, bright display, responsive, easy to handle. Superb reading experience. Creates a direct connection between you and the meaning of the text. Makes technology transparently ubiquitous.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent option for reading when travelling and not only
customer_reviews.text: Excellent option for reading when travelling and not only. The device is elegant , very light and the amazing feature of building up your own vocabulary for every book that you read in other language than yours , is amazing . This helps you learn new words and phrases , so you can very easy start to enhance your vocabulary and speech. Great idea, congrats!
